content: Obama sold out the nation's financial self-direction and stupidly or invidiously kowtowed to European control to supercede U.S. financial self-determination. One-world, the messiah seeks your blessings. Brussels bureaucrats shall prescribe how U.S. businesses may be permitted to conduct their business.
reply: Obama sold out the nation's financial self-direction and stupidly or invidiously kowtowed to European control to supercede U.S. financial self-determination. One-world, the messiah seeks your blessings. Brussels bureaucrats shall prescribe how U.S. businesses may be permitted to conduct their business.
title: Financial Decisions for Us from Brussels

content: quote: Originally posted by dmuhler: Bull ****. You are so predictable. Eternal economic truths are, indeed, determinable and do not really change; so you are correct, as far as you go, and what I wirte that derives from those truths will be predictable. (As opposed to the p*ss-poor, scatterbrained rationalizations of the leftist lemmings. One-world worshippers should be happy with the obamanation. Americans worthy of the name shall not be, unless the US backs off the stupid dance around the European maypole. There is ample opportunity for mutual support economically without selling out the US's institutions to those of Europe--or any other nations. (By the way, the word is bull****, not bull ****.)

content: When you consider all the taxes and fees you are only controlling about half your money. Then depending on how much you have left a good chunk of it goes for necessities. So you are really only controlling about 10% of your money.
reply: When you consider all the taxes and fees you are only controlling about half your money. Then depending on how much you have left a good chunk of it goes for necessities. So you are really only controlling about 10% of your money.

content: quote: Originally posted by dmuhler: quote: Originally posted by RRR52: quote: Originally posted by dmuhler: Bull ****. You are so predictable. Eternal economic truths are, indeed, determinable and do not really change; so you are correct, as far as you go, and what I write that derives from those truths will be predictable. (As opposed to the p*ss-poor, scatterbrained rationalizations of the leftist lemmings. One-world worshippers should be happy with the obamanation. Americans worthy of the name shall not be, unless the US backs off the stupid dance around the European maypole. There is ample opportunity for mutual support economically without selling out the US's institutions to those of Europe--or any other nations. (By the way, the word is bull****, not bull ****.) Roosevelt had a similar meeting in 1933 (London)about the similar economic conditions (recession), and many (reactionary right-wingers) said similar things about him. He in fact did not bargain away the keys to the kingdom, nor anything else for that matter. Also you should also know that the President is not authorized to make any treaties without consent of Congress. Roosevelt did not sit at the knees of a communist poet to have a father figure. Roosevelt did not require as much differebtiation from Europe in those days, since Europe was not yet so socialistic. Circumstances at the time were no recession, which is nowhere near what the Great Depression imposed on America; read the effects of that economic disaster, and if you have any understanding, if you read any reliable record, yo9u will find that, unless Obama screws up terribly, our immediate pain will be nowhere near what Roosevelt then dealt with. Europeans than still knew the value of wealth generation from capitalism. And Roosevelt is a quite an example upon which to refute anything economic . His foolish ideas about economics and excessively centralized control of the economy plunged the US into a depression far longer than would have been necessary with less guvmint intrusion and more reliance on wealth generation the only way it can reliably be maintained. I know well who formally ratifies treaties. But I also know well who can impose all sorts of leftist ideas and effectively subjugate US institutions to the desires of foreign bodies or organizations. Unless it is specifically forbidden--and maybe even then--the obamanation will be inclined to cave.

Circumstances at the time were no recession, which is nowhere near what the Great Depression imposed on America; read the effects of that economic disaster, and if you have any understanding, if you read any reliable record, yo9u will find that, unless Obama screws up terribly, our immediate pain will be nowhere near what Roosevelt then dealt with.
